newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea union leader says to launch partial strike.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea union leader says to launch partial strike.

text.p: The head of South Korea's outlawed Korean Confederation of Trade Unions said on Thursday union workers would go on partial strike on Friday.
Kwon Young-kil, president of the confederation, said in a news conference the confederation would delay an all-out strike to see how parliament handled the revision of a new labour law.

"We hope parliament will come up with a correct labour law this time. We will wait until midnight of February 28," Kwon told reporters. A controversial new labour law rammed through parliament in late December is due to take effect on March 1.

He said member unions in the Seoul area would walk out from 1:00 p.m. (0400 GMT) to 5:00 p.m. (0800 GMT). Workers at public services, including hospitals and the Seoul subway, would not take part in the work stoppage, he said.
Striking workers would rally in central Seoul to demand that the labour law be repealed, Kwon said.
The confederation claims 500,000 member workers nationwide.
